Benefits of Participating in the OpenJDK Quality Outreach Program

2023/07/01
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

The OpenJDK Quality Outreach Program is a collaboration between FOSS projects and OpenJDK to ensure a more robust Java platform. By joining this program, Java project maintainers can contribute to guaranteeing that the Java Platform remains the best and most stable platform for software developers.

Participating in the program is easy and offers real benefits. By actively reporting test results against early access versions of the OpenJDK, your test suite(s) become part of the overall suite of tests that help validate the quality of the next OpenJDK release. This means that your open source project can play a crucial role in shaping the future of Java.

To join the program, simply follow the instructions provided in the "How to join the Quality Outreach Program" section of the OpenJDK Quality Outreach Program introduction page.

In addition to contributing to the Java platform's stability, participating in the OpenJDK Quality Outreach Program also allows you to leverage the power of automated builds with GitHub Actions. By setting up automated builds for your project, you can easily run tests against early access builds of OpenJDK.

Don't miss out on the opportunity to be part of this program and make a significant impact on the Java community. Join the OpenJDK Quality Outreach Program today and help shape the future of Java development.
